author: terencechain
content:
I'm unsure if this is intentional. Some clients are requesting blob with an index off by 1. For example this block only has 5 blobs, but someone is requesting blob with index 5
Example: https://gist.github.com/terencechain/defc5934c565c35101927dff35dcee06

author: g11tech
content: lodestar only requests blobs based on commitments it sees ... so shouldn't be lodestar

author: tbenr
content: In some cases we could request all 6 blobs blindly (if we havent seen the block yet)

author: tbenr
content: looking at the gist yes it could be us

author: tbenr
content: But I'll give another check cose i would expect that we would request not all 6 blocks. Cose we trigger that when we see one or more blobs without the block, so we dont know how many blobs are there, so we request the block and all the potential missing blobs

author: terencechain
content: Thanks. to clarify it's not an off-by-one. It just happened again, and this time the block has 0 kzg commitment but we still got 6 requests from index 0 to 5

author: tbenr
content: So if you see a single peer requesting all blobs is weird

author: tbenr
content: Ok I'll check if we have a bug in that case

author: marcinds
content:
I finished spamming devnet-12.
Found a bug in Nethermind - we are not keeping max limit of blob txs, which is a regression, we were keeping it in the previous iteration of this experiment.
I will wait with spamming goerli until we fix it and release
